params.name: Name of the new ingredient for events

returns._0: The ID of the new ingredient

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

params.amounts: Array of amounts to burn for each ingredient
params.ids: Array of ingredient IDs to burn

params.amounts: Array of amounts to purchase for each ingredient
params.ids: Array of ingredient IDs to purchase

params._owner: The initial owner of the contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

uri(uint256).details: See {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}. This implementation returns the same URI for *all* token types. It relies on the token type ID substitution mechanism https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata[defined in the ERC]. Clients calling this function must replace the `\{id\}` substring with the actual token type ID.

PRICE_PER_INGREDIENT().notice: Price per ingredient in KitchenToken wei (10 tokens)

addIngredient(string).notice: Add a new ingredient type (only owner)

burn(address,uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Burn ingredients (only callable by DishNFT contract)

buyBatch(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Purchase ingredients in batch using KitchenTokens

dishNFT().notice: The DishNFT contract allowed to burn ingredients

ingredientExists(uint256).notice: Maps ingredient IDs to their existence

ingredientExistsById(uint256).notice: Check if an ingredient ID exists

kitchenToken().notice: The KitchenToken contract used for purchasing

nextIngredientId().notice: Next ingredient ID for future additions
